messages.content: Is the Bmad's Dirty Undo-Redo extension for ComfyUI still necessary?
No, as of Nov 28, 2023, ComfyUI has the undo/redo functionality, making the Bmad's Dirty Undo-Redo extension obsolete.
What action should be taken if I have an updated version of ComfyUI with built-in undo/redo?
If you have an updated version of ComfyUI with built-in undo/redo functionality, you will need to remove or disable the Bmad's Dirty Undo-Redo extension to avoid conflicts.
How can I completely remove the Bmad's Dirty Undo-Redo extension?
To completely remove the extension, you may need to delete the ZZZ-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo folder inside the web/extensions directory.
Are there keyboard shortcuts for undo and redo in ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo?
Yes, undo is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>/<kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>Z</kbd> and redo is <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>/<kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>Y</kbd> or <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>/<kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>Z</kbd>.
How can I install the ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo extension?
To install the extension, navigate to `/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/` folder and clone the repository from `https://github.com/bmad4ever/ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo`.

It is called 'dirty' because the author was mainly concerned with getting a somewhat working solution quickly and not so much with implementing it 'right'. For example, the undo/redo data contains snapshots of the entire serialized workflow (this is overkill), and the author has no plans to change it.
